Generation IV.Diamond: It slams foes by sharply uncoiling its rolled ears. It stings enough to make a grown-up cry in pain.
Generation IV.Pearl: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.
Generation IV.Platinum: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
Generation IV.HeartGold: You can tell how it feels by the way it rolls its ears. When it's scared, both ears are rolled up.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: You can tell how it feels by the way it rolls its ears. When it's scared, both ears are rolled up.

Generation V.Black: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
Generation V.White: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
Generation V.Black 2: By extending its rolled-up ears and striking the ground, it can bound so high it surprises itself.
Generation V.White 2: By extending its rolled-up ears and striking the ground, it can bound so high it surprises itself.

Generation VI.X: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
Generation VI.Y: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: Its ears are always rolled up. They can be forcefully extended to shatter even a large boulder.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.

Generation VII.Ultra Sun: Its arms and legs are weak, but when it rolls its ears up tight and then unleashes them with its full force, it can smash boulders to dust.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: The reason it keeps one ear rolled up is so it can launch a swift counterattack if it's attacked by an enemy.

Generation VIII.Sword: If both of Buneary's ears are rolled up, something is wrong with its body or mind. It's a sure sign the Pokémon is in need of care.
Generation VIII.Shield: Buneary can attack by rolling up their ears and then striking with the force created by unrolling them. This attack becomes stronger with training.
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It slams foes by sharply uncoiling its rolled ears. It stings enough to make a grown-up cry in pain.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: When it senses danger, it perks up its ears. On cold nights, it sleeps with its head tucked into its fur.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: My hypothesis as to why Buneary rolls up its ears is that its hearing is far too keen. I surmise that the Pokémon protects its hearing by limiting the sound that may enter its ears.

Generation VIII.Expansion Pass: Fields of Honor , Challenge Beach Fields of Honor ( Max Raid Battle )
Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: Eterna Forest Grand Underground - Spacious Cave , Grassland Cave , Sunlit Cavern , Riverbank Cave , Still-Water Cavern , Whiteout Cave , Icy Cave , Glacial Cavern
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: Eterna Forest Grand Underground - Spacious Cave , Grassland Cave , Sunlit Cavern , Riverbank Cave , Still-Water Cavern , Whiteout Cave , Icy Cave , Glacial Cavern
